Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; band of faded added white chequers above billet band between white bands; exterior: part of a lion to right with head turned back (head, mane and part of body); above on left, part of undetermined painted decoration.
Curator's comments: Lions on Simple Animal Style vases are usually facing right. Those facing left may have been part of an antithetical composition of confronting lions.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 842, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1050) (phase 2)
